result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy D. Baier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs/surcharges as set forth by Probation & Parole but within the first 10 months of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy D. Baier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Troy D. Baier in court with attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of plea agreement.  Defendant will plead to DC in 15CM24, Probation 1 yr. w/cond: no alcohol, no bars or taverns; other charges will be dismissed.    Court advises defendant of elements of count 1/max. penalties in 15CM24.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty, dismiss 15CM36.  Court confirms State complied with victim notification requirements and there are no victim impact statements.  Court withholds sentence & places defendant on 1 yr. probation with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entrance into bars or taverns; comply with any assessment or counseling as set up by P&P.  State informs court $25 restitution still owed.  Court orders defendant to pay today to the DA's Trust Account or will add as a condition of P&P; pay costs as set by P&P but w/in 1st 10 mos. of probation; provide a DNA sample.  Advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Troy D. Baier in court with attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of charge/max. penalties and rights.  NGP entered.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Attorney Mandy L. Caffee retained by Def.

Defendant Troy D. Baier in court.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant informs the court he has Atty Mandy Caffee.  Court shows defendant unrepresented until hear from an attorney.  Matter adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Phillip M. Steans moves the court for an order relieving the attorney from further represtation of the defendant in this case.  ...motion brought on grounds that the defendant has asked attorney to withdraw....
